Configuration instructions for the D-Link DWL-G122 using NdisWrapper

=== Instructions ===
----
Plug in a wired internet connection
----
Install NdisWrapper with 
<pre>
sudo apt-get install ndiswrapper-utils
</pre>
----
Download the driver from http://www.dlink.com/products/support.asp?pid=334&sec=0#drivers and unzip it into /home/<username>
----
Enter the directory with 
<pre>
cd D-Link\ AirPlus\ G\ Utility\(V1.00\ Build\ 40628\)\ with\ RaLink\ driver\ 1.0.0.0-98se\(1.2\)/Drivers/WinXP2K
</pre>
----
Install the driver with 
<pre>
sudo ndiswrapper -i NetRTUSB.inf
</pre>
----
Create a module alias for NdisWrapper with 
<pre>
sudo ndiswrapper -m
</pre>
----
Add the module with 
<pre>
sudo modprobe ndiswrapper
</pre>
----
Go to System>Administration>Networking
----
Select Wireless Connection
----
Click Properties
----
Tick enable this connection and enter your info (you're probably on DHCP, by the way)
----
Select Wireless Connection
----
Click Activate
----
Click OK
----
Unplug the wired internet connection and open up Firefox and go to a reliable site to check if it's working
----

=== Tested on... ===
(please leave a note here if these instructions work for you)

* Ubuntu 5.10 Breezy Badger x86
